content:
My friend Teresa just started using Zulip today. She self-registered, and when she saw "You look familiar" she assumed that meant she already had an account -- and then when she used "Forgot password" and it did not explicitly say anything about whether she had a pre-existing account or not, she didn't notice that. I had to help her out and say "try creating a new account" - otherwise she would have waited a long time.

But overall she likes the UI.

Yeah I just checked it with a random email and it didn't say anything about having not having pre-existing account. So the "Forgot password" page must throw an error if the email submitted doesn't have an account already!

It doesn't give you an error because (I assume this is the reason) we want to protect people's privacy. If I put in the address of someone I'm stalking, I shouldn't be able to find out whether or not they have an account.
I agree on that. But it may also leave people in a clueless state right?
Yeah, so I think it might be a good idea to be more explicit and less humorous about what we're doing.
But I figured I'd hear from one or two other people in this stream before filing a bug....
Thanks for the report Teresa and Sumana! I agree we should change it; opening an issue sounds good to me.
Thanks, Rishi! "Make login/forgot password pages more explicit to help new users" #4381
Any GSoC applicants around - this would be a reasonable bug to consider fixing.
